name: Carla
about: She is Lutz's mother.

name: Corinna
about: She's Otto's wife.

name: Eckhart
about:
Eckhart  is the oldest child of Karstedt and Elvira, and the older brother of Lamprecht, Cornelius, and Rozemyne.

He is an archknight who serves Ferdinand as a retainer. He also helps train new recruits to the Knight's Order, alongside his grandfather Bonifatius. 

(Source: Ascendance of a Bookworm Wiki)

name: Eva
about: Myne and Turi's mother. She has green like jade hair and green close to yellow-green eyes. She works at a dyery.

name: Ferdinand
about:
Ferdinand is the head priest in the temple of Ehrenfest, as well as the patron and educator of Myne in the temple. Ferdinand teaches and guides her to be a 'proper' shrine maiden and noble lady.

Ferdinand is a serious, disciplined and pragmatic person. He has a bit of a fussy personality, leading him to take on all sorts of responsibilities, including Myne's education. Ferdinand is meritocratic in spite of his social status, despising incompetence and laziness the most, and earning him the reputation of a harsh disciplinarian who would cut off anyone who couldn't meet his standard. The same trait leads him to favor Myne ever since their first interaction, calling her worthwhile to educate.

(Source: Ascendance of a Bookworm Wiki)

name: Fey
about: He has pink hair and looks like he plays a lot of pranks.

name: Gunther
about: Myne and Turi's dad. Gunther works as a guard in the city of Ehrenfest, primarily watching the gate. He is a loving father, if slightly overbearing in his affections for his daughters.

name: Ezil, Garou
about:
Garou Ezil is the Demon King who is usually very arrogant.

(Source: Official Site, edited)

name: Kirio, Reiji
about: Reiji was a corporate slave before getting transported to another world, and he's all too happy to accept his new life. Reiji possesses two skills: Medicine Appraisal and Medicine Making, allowing him to create any type of medicine he wants.

name: Mina
about: Mina is a ghost who acts as guardian for an abandoned house that Reiji bought early in the story. Thanks to her stored power over the years, she is able to manifest and maintain her human body form for a long time. Mina is initially unable to leave the house, but after Reiji found her pendant heirloom in the basement, she can freely go out by taking the pendant with her.

name: Noëla
about: Noëla is a wolf girl whom Reiji encountered when he first transferred to the other world. After getting rescued by Reiji, she calls him her master and vows to follow him wherever he goes. Noëla is a cheerful and somewhat mischievous girl, but she's serious in keeping Reiji safe (especially from other girls).

name: Alf
about:
Alf is the owner of the general store.

He appears in episode 1.

name: Alf's Wife
about:
She is the wife of the general store owner Alf.

She appears in episode 1.

name: Annabelle
about:
Annabelle is the daughter of the Mercenary Corps. She is addicted to a potion made by Reiji.

(Source: Official Site, edited)

name: Belial
about:
Belial is the butler of Ezil Garou that always buys potions for him.

He appears in episodes 2, 4, 6, and 7.

name: Casty
about: Casty is the lord of the Fen Dran Valgas family and the father of Elaine.

name: Doz
about:
Doz is part of the mercenary group lead by Annabelle.

He appears in episodes 2 and 9.

name: Fina
about:
Fina is a kind, honest, and hardworking girl. Having been forced to care for her family at a very young age, she is very responsible and mature. 

She has greenish-brown hair, half of which is usually tied at the back with a large pink ribbon. She has kind lime-green eyes and is usually seen smiling.

Fina wears an ankle length tea-green dress with a light brown vest worn over it. Occasionally she also wears a shoulder bag that contains most of her necessary belongings such as daggers and knives for skinning and money.



(Source: Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear Wiki)
voice_actor_name: Waki, Azumi, Huynh, Xanthe, Gries, Jana Dunja

name: Yuna
about: Yuna is the protagonist of Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear. She is a shut-in fifteen year old who fanatically played VRMMO World Fantasy Online when she receives a bear costume from the creators of the game and joins a new world.
voice_actor_name: Kawase, Maki, Lenti, Marissa, Dähn, Mayke

name: Ans
voice_actor_name: Haruno, Anzu, Nishimura, Trina, Leisner, Amira

name: Atla
about:
Atla is the guild master in the town of Millela's guild.

Yuna thought she was an exhibitionist because her outfit emphasised her breasts and had skin laid bare around the waist topped off with a mini skirt.

She is a bit shameless citing that she dresses the way she does because it makes the men happy. Despite that she despises the Commerce Guild for hiking up the price of fish and various food items to make a profit during the Town's hardship revealing a strong morality. She was an excellent guild master who did all she could for the sake of the residents.

(Source: Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear Wiki)
voice_actor_name: Connors, Amber Lee, Asumi, Kana, Gwisdalla, Ilena

name: Bo
voice_actor_name: Okamura, Akemi, Leonard, Linda, Anzinger, Dorothea

name: Farrengram, Misaana
name_kanji: ミサーナ・ファーレングラム
voice_actor_name: Amano, Satomi, Angelle, Felecia, Maron, Mia

name: Flora
voice_actor_name: Kino, Hina, Lauda, Brittany, Schmidt, Lara

name: Foschurose, Shia
name_kanji: シア・フォシュローゼ
about:
Shia had a very prideful and arrogant personality before meeting . Initially, she believed that she is one of the strongest students at her school and that no girl is stronger than her. But after suffering a devastating defeat at the hands of Yuna, she becomes less conceited.

Shia is the elder sister of  and the daughter of  and . She currently lives with her mother in the Royal Capital and attends the Royal Academy, while her sister and father live together in Crimonia.

Shia wears her blonde hair split into two pig tails, with a strand of hair falling out on both sides. Shia is often seen in a typical school uniform which has a sleeveless navy-greyish jumper worn on top of her white shirt and a black tie. She wears a red and white checkered skirt and thigh length socks. Like her younger sister, Shia has purple eyes and has a paler skin colour.

(Source: Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear Wiki)
voice_actor_name: Minase, Inori, Shipman, Megan, Markiefka, Angelina

name: Foschurose, Noire
name_kanji: ノアール・フォシュローゼ

name: Agumon
about:
Agumon is a short and stout dinosaur-like Digimon. The most well-known appearance of Agumon is in the Digimon Adventure anime as the partner of Taichi Yagami, in which Agumon's personality is extremely brave, relaxed, and funny. He can evolve into Greymon (Champion), MetalGreymon (Ultimate), WarGreymon (Mega) and Omnimon through DNA Digivolution with MetalGarurumon. There are also two subspecies of WarGreymon called VictoryGreymon (Ultimate), which debuts in the "Digimon Next" manga and also appears in some games, and BlitzGreymon (Mega) from "Digimon Adventure:", which evolves from the variant MetalGreymon: Alterous Mode and is the final form of the Greymon Species.

In Digimon Savers, Agumon is given a slightly different design as he is taller, has more teeth, longer claws, wider forearms and red training bracers. He is partnered with Masaru Daimon and evolves into GeoGreymon (Champion), RizeGreymon (Ultimate) and ShineGreymon/ShineGreymon Burst Mode (Mega).

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Gabumon
about:
Gabumon is a yellow-skinned wolf-like Digimon about 2 and a half feet tall. He has a horn on his head and a tail. His back is covered  in a dog-like blue fur pelt. He evolves from Tsunomon (In-Training form), which evolves from Punimon (Fresh Form). It later evolves in Garurumon (Champion form), WereGarurumon (Ultimate form), MetalGarurumon (MegaForm) and, in Digimon  Adventure 02, fuses with WarGraymon in DNA Digivolution into Omnimon.

In the series, his partner is Yamato "Matt" Ishida.

name: Ishida, Yamato
about:
Age: 7 (Digimon movie part one), 11 (Digimon 01), 14 (Digimon 02), 17 (Digimon Tri.)
Birthday: 1988

Yamato, one of the original DigiDestined, starts out as a secretive loner whose Digimon partner is Gabumon. His younger brother, Takeru Takaishi, is also one of the eight DigiDestined. Yamato is the bearer of the Crest of Friendship. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Patamon
about:
Patamon is a small orange cute flying guinea pig like creature with light blue eyes and bat-like wings, which could possibly be his ears. This mammal digimon has also been considered to look like a mouse or pig with wings.

Patamon is a main character in Digimon Adventure and Digimon Adventure 02, as well as the movies Digimon Adventure (The movie), Our War Game!, The Golden Digimentals and Diaboromon Strikes Back. Patamon also appears as a supporting character in Digimon Frontier.

Patamon is the playful Digimon partner of Takeru. In Digimon Adventure, Patamon was the last of the Digi-Destined Digimon to achieve his Champion form, and the last again to achieve his Ultimate form. However, both his Champion and Ultimate forms are immensely powerful for their respective level, and are responsible for defeating Devimon and the final Dark Master, Piedmon respectively.

Takeru returns as a main character in the second Digimon Adventure 02 season, as does Patamon. Because of the Digimon Emperor's control spires, Patamon was no longer able to Digivolve into his Champion form, and instead fought in his Armor form when he uses the Digi-Egg of Hope - Pegasusmon. In the 2020 series, Patamon can Digivolve to Pegasusmon without the Digi-Egg of Hope.

In the series, Patamon has a childish and sensitive personality.

Attacks:

Boom Bubble (Air Shot): Patamon's body inflates as he gulps in air - which he then shoots forward from his mouth.

Slamming Attack (Body Slam): Patamon charges at his enemy attempting to knock them out (This attack is very rarely used).

Patamon evolve into Angemon (Champion) or Pegasusmon/Pegasmon (Champion), MagnaAngemon/HolyAngemon (Ultimate), Shakkoumon (Ultimate, DNA Digivolution between Ankylomon and Angemon) and Seraphimon (Mega)

name: Tachikawa, Mimi
about:
Age: 6 (Digimon movie part one), 10 (Digimon 01), 13 (Digimon 02), 16 (Digimon Tri.)
Birthday: 1989

Mimi is kind and caring - although initially slightly selfish and self-centered - and obsessed with her outer appearance. Deep down inside, she's a very sweet girl. She's used to royal treatment so living in the Digital World isn't exactly her cup of tea. Her Digimon partner, Palmon, tries to help her understand that outer appearances aren't everything. Mimi possesses the Crest of Purity.

In 02, Mimi spends a lot of time in America. She returns with her hair dyed her favorite color (pink) and a new wardrobe. She still acts like a princess but has matured enough to know that there are more important things in life.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Tailmon
about:
Tailmon appears similar to a white Egyptian kitten, with enormous yellow and red gloves and black claws. In the dub, she speaks in a soft, drawling voice. The Japanese version, however, has her in a much older voice to reflect her maturity as an adult level Digimon. As Plotmon, she acts more youthful like many of the Child level Digimon. Her name, "Gatomon," comes from "gato," which means "cat" in Spanish, Greek, and Portuguese.

Tailmon first appeared in Digimon Adventure as a malicious Digimon working for Vamdemon. As a Digi-Egg, Tailmon had been separated from the other seven Chosen Digimon. When she later digivolved into Plotmon, Vamdemon took her under his wing. Plotmon eventually naturally evolved into Tailmon and became one of Vamdemon's lieutenants in his army of Digimon. During this time, she gained a rival in one of his other minions, PicoDevimon, as the two competed for their master's favor. Her only friend was Wizarmon, a friendly Digimon who Tailmon had once helped. Tailmon also bears red X-shaped scars from when Vamdemon "beat" her because he did not like her eyes.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Takaishi, Takeru
about:
Age: 4 (Digimon movie part one), 8 (Digimon 01), 11 (Digimon 02), 14 (Digimon Tri.)
Birthday: 1991

Takeru is the youngest Chosen Child out of the core seven. He is gentle, sweet-natured, and generous. He is also obedient and follows the Chosen Children's lead without complaints. He is also described as Hikari Yagami's "equal."

Takeru is the only Chosen Child to not attend the same school as the rest of the others initially due to living in Sangenjaya instead of Odaiba. He is younger brother of Yamato, but lives with his mother, journalist Natsuko Takaishi, instead due to a divorce between their parents. 

Although Takeru was too young to remember the events of the divorce clearly, he is still affected by it and does not like to openly talk about it. Despite the distance between him and Yamato, he admires Yamato greatly and tries to be brave to "impress" him, although he begins to open up to the other Chosen Children as well, particularly Taichi.

In the sequel, Digimon Adventure 02, Takeru and his mother relocate to a new apartment building in Odaiba, where he becomes neighbors with Iori Hida and Miyako Inoue. Although he has gotten remarkably taller, his gentle personality has not changed and it makes him popular with the girls at school. He is also said to have "inherited reliability from Yamato." In addition to this, Takeru becomes the star player on his school's basketball team.

name: Yagami, Hikari
about:
Age: 4 (Digimon movie part one), 8 (Digimon 01), 11 (Digimon 02), 14 (Digimon Tri.)
Birthday: 1991

She is partnered to Tailmon/Gatomon and she is the younger sister of Taichi "Tai" Kamiya. Kari, by nature, is kind and sweet-hearted, always looking for the best in people, and avoids fighting them when possible. She can be serious, especially in drastic situations. She bears the Crest of Light and her representative color is pink. (This color is echoed in her trousers and scarf, although Kari's polo shirt is yellow in season 1. In Season 2, Kari dresses entirely in pink.) Her elemental affinity is light. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Yagami, Taichi
about:
Age: 7 (Digimon movie part one), 11 (Digimon 01), 14 (Digimon 02), 17 (Digimon Tri.)
Birthday: 1988

Tai Kamiya, known in Japan as Taichi Yagami (八神 太一, Yagami Taichi), is a fictional character from the first two seasons of the anime Digimon Adventure and Digimon Adventure 02, as well as in the Digimon Adventure V-Tamer 01 manga.

He is characterized as an adventurous, happy, carefree but naïve character who wears a set of goggles, a characteristic that is shared among the leaders of the various DigiDestined or (Chosen Children in the Japanese version) in Digimon However, unlike the other leaders, he wears a blue headband underneath his goggles. He is the older brother to Kari Kamiya (Hikari Yagami in Japan).

As a leader, he almost always acts in a rash and stubborn way without realizing the consequences of his actions (The V-Tamer version is more of a planner). His stubborn and hot-tempered attitude makes him not to listen his comrades for a plan. This has led him to moments of friction and guilt between his friend/rival Matt Ishida (Yamato Ishida in Japan), his oldest friend Sora Takenouchi, as well as his Digimon partner Agumon. However, he manages to do whatever is necessary to rectify the situation, and in times of need, save friends and family from certain doom. He is the bearer of the Crest of Courage.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Abbadomon
about:
Abbadomon is an Unidentified Digimon. It is a mysterious Digimon that digivolved enormously by absorbing the negative data that the Network is overflowing with beyond its limit. Its raison d'être is to transcend good and evil, and return everything to nothingness. It bites into Digimon and the Digital World itself with the large mouth at its center and the mouths on its numerous tentacles, and after doing so, only the blank data of empty space is left behind. The birth of Abbadomon is undoubtedly a crisis for all Digital Worlds, so it is conjectured that some Digital Worlds from other dimensions have been annihilated by it. You will be erased the instant you suffer any of Abbadomon attacks.

(Source: Digimon Wiki)

Ryouma is also obsessed with slimes and keeps them as pets, trying to find and create new types of slime whenever possible.

name: Kamikoshi, Sorawo
about:
Sorawo Kamikoshi is a timid and antisocial university student with a knack for exploring ruins. Although she is well-versed in urban legends, she expresses dislike for what she considers "fake rumors" — as opposed to "true ghost stories" that are primary accounts of witnesses to paranormal events.

Sorawo found the "Otherside" by chance and initially planned to make it her secret retreat, until she met Toriko there. Together, they explore the Otherside, uncovering its mysteries and collecting artifacts to sell to Kozakura for research. After a confrontation with a Kunekune from the Otherside, Sorawo's right eye is left permanently blue and gains the ability to see the Otherside beings' "core." She usually wears a brown contact lens in order to not draw attention to it. It appears that she is more susceptible to being manipulated by illusion-type apparitions, usually requiring Toriko to snap her out of the hypnotic trance she's put in.

About her family:
voice_actor_name: Hanamori, Yumiri, Morris, Madeleine, Witt, Nina

name: Nishina, Toriko
about:
Toriko is a mysterious girl Sorawo meets in the Otherside. She invites Sorawo to her forays into the Otherside, offering money in exchange for help in locating her mentor, Satsuki, who'd gone missing in the Otherside during a solo expedition. Toriko is usually frivolous by nature and adept at using guns and survival tactics, but also quite perceptive at reading Sorawo's mood and tactful about other people's past and circumstances, although she can come across as blunt and insensitive when interacting with people she doesn't know too well.

After a confrontation with a Kunekune from the Otherside, Toriko's left hand is left translucently blue and can grab onto incorporeal Otherside beings and portals after Sorawo uses her right eye on them. She usually wears a glove on that hand in order to not draw unwanted attention to it. Later, Toriko remarks that her left hand can bleed when she accidentally gets a cut there.

About her family:
voice_actor_name: Kayano, Ai, Neves, Emily, Fölster, Julia

name: Abarato
about: Abarato is extremely cautious, paranoid, and a high-strung individual. Because of this, he's managed to find many a trap laid around in Otherside. He also can be extremely deluded as shown when he mistakes Toriko for his missing wife Michiko. Aside from his personality flaws, he has shown compassion towards Toriko when he learns that she's looking for her missing friend Satsuki.

name: Barker, Ray
about: Major Ray Barker, second in command of a U.S. Marine battalion, while leading his men in survival training in the mountains of Okinawa, find they have crossed over into the Otherside. Now, having been stuck in there for a month, he still searches for a way to get them all home.
voice_actor_name: Rudolf, Christian, Masumoto, Takuya, Guerrero, Chris

name: Greg
voice_actor_name: Ono, Yuuki, Kametz, Billy, Fallow, Vincent

name: Ichikawa, Natsumi
about: Natsumi is Akari's childhood friend. Unlike Akari, who attends university, Natsumi has been working in her family's auto repair shop since she was in high school. Natsumi's red hair and blunt manner of speaking give Sorawo the impression that she is a delinquent, but Akari mentions that, like Sorawo, Natsumi is simply uncomfortable around people she doesn't know that well. In exchange for the help received in dealing with the Sannuki-san apparition, Natsumi agrees to modify Sorawo and Toriko's AP-1 vehicle.

name: Kozakura
about: Kozakura speaks in a candid fashion and detests Toriko's officious behavior around her. She, however, tolerates Toriko's behavior as she goes out of her way to search the mysterious land of the Otherside, in hopes to find her friend Satsuki. Kozakura had explained that her serotonin transport gene is short (prone to get scared easily), she avoids going to the Otherside as much as possible leaving Sorawo and Toriko to do the field work instead. Despite her blunt and insensitive attitude towards the pair, she cares and looks out for them, sometimes showing concern whenever they go to the Otherside. She is a petite young lady with very long hair white. She often dresses in an oversized plain shirt and dark-colored shorts.

name: Claes, Catarina
about:
Birthday: June 24
Position: Eldest daughter of a duke
Personality: Pure and dense
Magic Element: Earth
Specialty: Tree Climbing, Earth Raiser
Signature Moves: Charming Others

The only daughter of Duke Claes who regains her memories of her past life when she hits her head on a rock when she was eight. In her past life, she was an otaku and she remembered the night before she died, she was playing an Otome game called "Love Fortune" which is now the world she is in except she isn't the heroine. She is the main rival, and no matter which route she takes, she gets a terrible ending!

Her thoughts are sometimes portrayed by five chibi versions of herself that exist only in her mind. They are Happy Catarina, Studious Catarina, Fearless Catarina, Spineless Catarina, and Chairman Catarina.

name: Asmodeus, Alice
name_kanji: アスモデウス ・アリス
about:
Gender: Male
Ability: Fire Magic
Familiar: Gorgon Snake
Nicknames: Azu-Kun, Azu-Azu

Asmodeus is the top student at Babirus Demon School and one of Iruma's closest friends. After being defeated by Iruma, he pledges loyalty to him.
voice_actor_name: Kimura, Ryouhei, Kametz, Billy, Pejon, Marcus, Leguizamo, Elliot

name: Suzuki, Iruma
about:
Iruma Suzuki is a 14-year-old human boy who is sent to the netherworld when his selfish parents sell him to a demon named Sullivan. He is a cheerful and mild-natured boy who has a habit of being a pushover and unable to turn down an earnest request.

Sullivan asks Iruma to be his grandson and enrolls him in the Babyls Demon School, where he is placed in the Misfit class along with his classmates, Asmodeus Alice and Clara Valac. Terrified of being found out as a human and being eaten, Iruma must learn to adjust to his new life in the netherworld and blend in with his demon classmates at school.

Possession: Gluttonous feeder ring
Familiar: Professor Kalego
voice_actor_name: Murase, Ayumu, Stahl, Laura, Becerril, Diego, Lucindo, Fábio, Frenchel, Vivian

about: Female friend of Iruma. Clara really likes playing games and has been exiled for her childish antics. Despite her care-free nature, she is very powerful.

name: Agares, Picero
about: Agares wears the typical school uniform except for the bow leaving his coat open. His sleeves are either longer than normal or simply too long for his arms, reaching up to his knuckles. Under his coat is what seems like a buttoned-up pajama shirt with sleeves reaching farther than his coat. He also doesn't wear any shoes, revealing his white socks. On his head he has what's either a self-conscious eye mask (probably like a familiar) or some sort of eyeglass akin to scuba goggles. He also has pointy ears, fangs that sometimes stick out, hair that is curly on the ends and is shaped like a cone, and wings.
voice_actor_name: Yoshinaga, Takuto, Anderson, Brian, Bonilla, Carlos Enrique, Marques, Felipe

name: Alicred
about:
The physical embodiment of the Ring of Gluttony.

In its first form as a ghost-like appearance, it did not have any defining attitude but was only gluttonous, and very cranky as it screamed loudly that all that were present in the school had heard the cry, much to their dismay. It was shown to have mellowed out thanks to Clara Valac's lullaby.

Alicred eventually gained intelligence, and with it came a playful personality. However, Alicred still holds its protective nature over Iruma. 

(Source: Mairimashita! Iruma-kun Wiki)

name: Ami, Kirio
about:
When he was a child, Kirio's magic power capacity was measured and found to be none, which worried and disappointed his family as their household was known for their notably high power capacity.

He was then sent to Demon Children's Garden, an elementary correctional institution that raises and exerts full control over young demons. There, he experiences a strict and harsh environment as he was told he was dirtying his family name and was bullied for it. Amidst the negativity in the garden, he met and befriended a girl around his age at that time who was similar to him in terms of grades. She let him touch her charm, her grandmother's earring, which she said would make him feel more cheerful. However, the bullies took it and threw it off the cliff. Kirio managed to catch it with his barrier, but it broke as he lost focus and the earring fell while the girl watched in despair. After the incident, the girl quit the Garden while Kirio was forced to remain by his parents.



(Source: Mairimashita! Iruma-kun Wiki)

Grimm is also known to become languid when exposed to the sun making her deeply tired in the process.

about:

Weapons & Equipment: Old combat armor, Combat Knife, Sidearm, Miniature Teleporter, Anti-Armored Vehicle Vibrating Blade Bad Sword Type-R.

Six is a Combatant for Kisaragi, meaning his body has been reconstructed to be stronger.

Thanks to his reconstruction surgery, Six can adapt to any environment. His physical abilities are at the limit that the human frame can handle. He has basic night vision, being able to see silhouette in darkness, and can see underwater. There's also a chip inside his head that can translate alien languages.

Six is a senior in the organization being the oldest member of the organization left except for the generals. That is why, when the company was on the verge of the global conquest, Six was one of the candidates to explore an alternate world similar to Earth in order to conquer it.

Six is very perverted, being his lewd acts the main source of his Evil Points, and also tends to hold grudges. It's noticed that in strategy, Six tends to use coward methods, like taking hostages and attacking weak or distracted enemies.

Whenever Six make mistakes, Alice would try to often cover for him. They act exactly like siblings although Alice feels a lot more like the elder one.

(Source: Sentouin, Hakenshimasu! Wiki)

The main protagonist of the series and Founder as well as Chancellor and King of the monster nation known as the Jura-Tempest Federation. Originally Mikami Satoru, a 37-year-old general contractor, he was stabbed by a passing robber while protecting one of his co-workers and reincarnated in a new world as a slime, one of the lowest monsters on the food chain.

In spite of the situations he finds himself in, he often tends to be very easygoing, yet calculating and cautious. A pacifist at heart, he tries to avoid casualties and save people if possible and wishes to maintain good relations with humans.


(Source: Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken Wiki, edited)

name: Daikenja
about:
Name: Great Sage (Daikenja)


Entity Type: Unique Skill

Appearance:
Great Sage does not possess a physical form. It exists as an inner voice or consciousness within the wielder, providing unparalleled guidance and analytical abilities.

Background:
Great Sage is a highly sophisticated and unique skill acquired by Rimuru Tempest upon his reincarnation into the Jura Forest as a slime. This skill manifested as an advanced, sentient form of intelligence, designed to aid and guide Rimuru through his journey in this fantastical world.

Role and Contributions:

Advisor and Strategist:
Great Sage serves as the primary advisor to Rimuru, offering insights and strategies to navigate complex situations. Its analytical prowess allows for informed decision-making, ensuring Rimuru can effectively manage both peaceful and combative scenarios.

Skill Enhancement and Evolution:
Great Sage plays a crucial role in enhancing Rimuru's abilities. Over time, it evolves into the Ultimate Skill Raphael, significantly amplifying its capabilities and support functions.

Combat and Defense:
In combat, Great Sage is indispensable. It devises tactics, analyzes opponents' weaknesses, and suggests optimal strategies. This ensures that Rimuru can utilize his vast array of skills and powers to their fullest potential.

Knowledge and Information Processing:
Possessing an immense database of knowledge about the world, its creatures, magic, and more, Great Sage processes information at incredible speeds, keeping Rimuru well-informed and prepared for any situation.

Emotional Support:
Beyond its technical functions, Great Sage provides emotional support, helping Rimuru maintain composure and focus during challenging times.

Abilities:

Thought Acceleration:
Speeds up the wielder's thought processes, enabling rapid analysis and decision-making.
Analysis and Assessment:
Analyzes objects, skills, and creatures to understand their properties and potential uses.
Parallel Processing:
Handles multiple tasks simultaneously without burdening the primary consciousness.
Auto Battle Mode:
Can autonomously take over combat functions, fighting on the wielder's behalf with precision and efficiency.
Skill Acquisition and Integration:
Assists in acquiring new skills and seamlessly integrating them into the wielder's repertoire.



Significance:
Great Sage is the cornerstone of Rimuru Tempest's success and growth. Its guidance and support are instrumental in Rimuru's rise from a simple slime to a powerful leader and protector. Great Sage embodies the blend of intellect, strategy, and emotional support, making it an indispensable part of Rimuru's journey and the thriving nation he builds.

(Source: Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken Wiki)

name: Fujimaru, Ritsuka
about:
Ritsuka was a candidate for Master at the Security Organization for the Preservation of Humanity, Chaldea. As one of the low-level novices, he was summoned to Chaldea simply to fill their quota for potential Masters. However, the tragic explosion that devastated Chaldea left him as mankind's sole surviving Master and since then, as he was the only one left capable of Rayshifting, he has taken up the mission to eliminate the Singularities and save humanity's future.

(Source: anime.fate-go.us)

name: Kyrielight, Mash
name_kanji: マシュ・キリエライト
about:

Mash is a mysterious, kind-hearted girl. She refers to the Protagonist as her senior, however, behind that smile belies a deep sorrow and resolve that has accepted her fate as a person with a set life-span.


(Source: Type-Moon Wiki)

name: Aka no Saber
about:
Servant of Shishigou Kairi as part of the Red Faction in the Turifas Holy Grail War of Fate/Apocrypha.

Saber's identity is Mordred, the "son" of King Arthur, but she is actually female despite being raised as the secret male heir to the throne. She was told to hide her status and obey the king.


In the Fate/stay night anime, Mordred did appear in one of Saber's flashbacks.

(Source: Type-Moon Wiki)

about:
Height/Weight: 151cm, 40kg
Origin: History
Region: Europe
Alignment: Neutral-Good
Gender: Male

In the 4th century BC, he was the young prince of Macedonia.
A young boy with no equal, he was discovered by various wise men, starting with the philosopher Aristotle, to be a genius.
A simple boy that loved the Iliad from the bottom of his heart, he was the manifestation of possibility itself.

nicknames: Attila the Hun, Attila the Third, Saber
about: Altera is a Saber-class Servant, better known in history as Attila the Hun.

He is a the former head of the Animusphere family and Chaldea Security Organization, later taken over by his daughter Olgamally Animusphere after his death.

Source: Dumas' work of "The Count of Monte Cristo"?

(Source: TYPE-MOON Wiki)

name: Albedo
about:
Albedo is the Overseer of the Floor Guardians of the Great Tomb of Nazarick. She is in charge of the general management and supervises the activities of the seven Floor Guardians, meaning that she ranks above all the other NPCs in Nazarick. She is the sister of Nigredo and Spinel. She was created by Tabula Smaragdina.

An impeccable beauty, Albedo is a woman with lustrous jet-black hair and the face of a goddess. She has golden irises and vertically split pupils; on her left and right temples are two thick horns protruding crookedly, and on her waist is a pair of black angel wings.

Albedo wears a pure white dress with silky gloves covering her slender hands, and a golden spiderweb necklace that covers her shoulders and chest. In combat, she wears an impressive black full plate armor with a unique helm and carries a battle-axe with her.

Like Shalltear, Albedo has a true form as a heteromorphic race NPC. Shalltear called her a "big mouthed gorilla" when they quarreled, so her true form may be quite large in size.

Extremely loyal and extremely in love, Albedo is completely infatuated with Momonga, often showing obsessive tendencies when it comes to his affairs. She is always vying for Momonga's affection, showcasing outbursts of jealousy whenever anyone else appears to be getting close to him. This is because the last thing Momonga did in Yggdrasil was to use his administrative privileges to edit her character history, adding the she is "madly in love" with him.

Among all the Guardians, Albedo is the most vocal when it comes to expressing opinions. She will openly denounce any statement or action deemed inappropriate, reaching the point where Momonga sometimes considers it an annoyance.

As the Overseer of the Floor Guardians, she is very levelheaded. Albedo can make calm and collected judgments that Ainz, sometimes, doesn't think of. She takes Ainz's orders as top priority and absolute, punishing anyone, even a Floor Guardian, who'd dare belittle his orders. Like many others in Nazarick, she absolutely loathes humans and views them as an inferior species.

In the web novel version, Albedo does not exist.


(Source: Overlord Wiki)

name: Aqua
about:
Birthday: August 1
Height: 158 cm
Weight: 49 kg
Three sizes: B83-W56-H83

The goddess of water who judged humans to send to the RPG world, up until Kazuma dragged her along with him. She is an energetic and simpleminded girl who likes to receive reverence for her status and gets upset easily. As an Archpriest and a goddess, she is powerful against demons and the undead, and is able to resurrect recently deceased people as well as purify water supplies. Rather than learning skills which would benefit her party, she spends most of her skill points learning Party Tricks.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Degurechaff, Tanya
name_kanji: ターニャ・デグレチャフ
about: Tanya Degurechaff is a cute, adorable and pretty-good looking little girl. But deep inside, she is highly power-hungry, amoral, ruthless, sadistic and hot-tempered. Especially when she is in battle against her enemies, she shows utter ruthlessness and bloodlust just to accomplish her missions. Tanya also strongly disapproves of failure and disobedience from her subordinates. She is loyal to her own job and always wants to finish it as soon as possible. Tanya will never let anyone discriminate her appearance because of how fast she goes through the ranks in the military.

name: Emilia
about:
Birthday: September 23
Height: 164 cm (5'4.5")

The main female protagonist. She is a silver-haired half-elf girl who is one of the candidates to become the next ruler in the royal election. Subaru first meets her when her insignia is stolen by Felt as she needs to possess it to be eligible to participate in the election. She introduces herself as Satella when she and Subaru met during the first timeline before introducing herself by her real name when she got her insignia back.

Emilia is good natured and likes to take care of others, though she herself refuses to admit it, instead thinking of it as her own selfishness. She is indifferent to her own appearance, leaving Puck to take care of her clothes and hair. Because her appearance is similar to the Witch of Envy, she has received unfair discrimination from others. She sometimes acts like a child and is unacquainted with the world as she used to live in the woods with other Elves, though despite this she still works hard to become a ruler.

name: Filo
about:
Age: <1
Race: Filolial

Filo was originally hatched from a monster egg which Naofumi purchased from the slave trader.

Filo grew at an abnormally fast rate and in just a few days grown into a fully grown Filolial later developing into a rare species of Filolial Queen where she was later given the ability to transform into a humanoid form strongly resembling a Angel and the ability to talk due to her association with the Shield Hero and the effects of the Legendary Shield.

(Source: Shield-Hero Wiki)

name: Iwatani, Naofumi
about:
Age: 19
Race: Human
Country: Japan (former), Melromarc: Rock Valley
Occupation: University Student (former), Legendary Hero
Weapon: Legendary Shield

Naofumi Iwatani is the main protagonist of The Rising of the Shield Hero.

He was a university student before being summoned to another world, where he had to fight against the waves of calamity, as one of the 4 cardinal heroes summoned. He was, however, the shield hero, regarded by many and especially people in Melromarc as the weakest of the heroes.

Due to his status as shield hero, many refused to join his side, the only exception being Myne Sophia. Myne however falsely accuses him of sexual assault causing him to lose his dignity and all his money
Due to this, the once cheerful Naofumi became a cynical character who lost the ability to trust in people.

He buys the slave Raphtalia and the bird Filo, but treats them like his daughters rather than his slaves.


(Source: Shield-Hero Wiki)

name: Momonga
about:
Ainz Ooal Gown (アインズ・ウール・ゴウン), formerly known as Momonga (モモンガ), is the main protagonist of the Overlord series. He is the guild master of Ainz Ooal Gown, Overlord of the Great Tomb of Nazarick, and the creator of Pandora's Actor. He is regarded as the highest of the Almighty Forty-One Supreme Beings by the NPCs of Nazarick.

A cautious and stingy person, Momonga always tries to plan and control details, avoiding any haphazard actions. Because he doesn't underestimate his opponents, he will usually overkill them. Since being transferred to a new world and becoming an actual Undead being, Momonga could feel himself becoming very cold and calculating, his emotions repressed.

Loyal to his friends and creations, since becoming Lord Ruler of Nazarick in the new world he acts with a certain degree of nobility for his devoted followers. Momonga only does things that will benefit Nazarick or himself, whether it's information or prestige. Although he does have a sense of justice and doesn't hate humans as much as his followers, he holds no attachment to them, and he feels nothing toward their deaths.


(Source: Overlord Wikia)

name: Natsuki, Subaru
about:
Age: 17→18
Birthday: April 1
Height: 173 cm (5'8")

On the way home from the convenience store, he suddenly finds himself transported into another world. He has the ability that he calls "Return by Death" to go back in time when he dies, with only himself being aware of the reversal of time. Despite being a hikikomori and gamer in his real world, Subaru does a bit of workout and seems to know basic hand-to-hand combat, making him not completely weak.

While Subaru tends to not read the situation, he is loyal to those he holds dear, willing to help them, even if that means taking the thorny path. He has his resolve confirmed through the many situations and circumstances he faces in the fantasy world, originally having been one to always take the "easy" route. As a hikikomori, he is hopeful of the possibilities that being sucked into a new realm brings, but later realizes the realities of the predicament he is in. Ultimately, he resolves himself to be faithful and protective of the ones that he cares most about.

(Source: Re:Zero Wiki)

name: Raphtalia
about:
Age: 10 (mentally), 17 (biologically)
Height: 5'6" (168 cm)
Raphtalia is a Tanuki-type Demi-Human who was the first real member of the Shield Hero's party after he purchased her as a slave.

She has undergone some significant changes throughout the story. When Raphtalia is first introduced, she is a child that has long, unmanaged hair and a dirty cloth gown. After being purchased by Naofumi, he gave her a haircut to an acceptable length, gave her a bath, and bought her a much more suitable set of clothes to adventure in.

After several weeks of traveling with Naofumi, Raphtalia's body inexplicably changes and she gained the appearance of a teenager or young adult. It is revealed that demi-humans grow in relation to the progression of their levels, which led to Raphtalia's rapid development.


(Source: Shield-Hero Wiki)

name: Satou, Kazuma
about:
Age: 17 Height: 165 cm

The main protagonist of KonoSuba. A sixteen-year-old Japanese teenager who became a game-obsessed shut-in after having his heart broken over his childhood friend during middle school. He is sent to the parallel reality after dying from acute stress reaction, forcing Aqua to come with him after she irritates him with her attitude. Kazuma is classed as an Adventurer which, despite being the lowest ranked class, allows him to learn various skills from other classes, albeit at an increased cost. With his ability, Kazuma learns basic skills such as stealing, archery, monster detection, and basic magic.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name_kanji: ディアブロ / 坂本 拓真
about: Originally a shut-in gamer who went by the name "Diablo" in the MMO "Cross Reverie." Having spent hours playing, he could defeat any player using his superior equipment and overwhelming skill. After being summoned one day to another world where he had the body of his in-game character, he finds himself the owner of two girls, a Pantherian and an elf, due to their invocation magic reflecting back at them due to an item of his.

Due to her work with miracles Lumachina is given the title of "High Priest" and is often asked to perform miracles through her prayers.

about:

name: Amidonia, Julius
name_kanji: ユリウス・アミドニア
about:
Julius Amidonia, later renamed as Julius Lastania (ユリウス・ラスタニア), is the exiled, unofficial ruler of Amidonia before its annex. He is the son of the late Gaius Amidonia and older brother of Roroa Amidonia.


Julius was a vain, egotistical individual, and had dreams of grandeur and conquest. Though not as hot-headed as his father, he did share the same ideals. However, his ability to govern a country was severely lacking as he did not understand the needs of the Amidonian citizens, nor was he able to solve domestic issues, since, like his father, he followed a 'military first' outlook.

His personality becomes a bit more subdued after the disastrous invasion of Elfrieden and the annexation of his country. He initially held a large grudge against Kazuya for his defeat and for taking away his country and birthright.



(Source: How a Realist Hero Rebuilt the Kingdom Wiki)
voice_actor_name: Nojima, Kenji, Matranga, David, Mello, Vitor, Torres, Carlos, Vucetic, Bojan

name: Amidonia, Gaius
name_kanji: ガイウス・アミドニア
about:
Gaius Amidonia is the father of Julius Amidonia and Roroa Amidonia and the crown prince of the Principality of Amidonia.

Gaius is an arrogant and prideful man, who carried a longstanding grudge against the Elfrieden Kingdom, due to the war 50 years ago, where Amidonia lost half of its territory. He followed a 'military-first' policy and waited for the opportunity for revenge against Elfrieden.

(Source: How a Realist Hero Rebuilt the Kingdom Wiki)
voice_actor_name: Inada, Tetsu, Potter, Brandon, Emílio, César

name: Amidonia, Roroa
about:
Roroa Amidonia is the daughter of Gaius Amidonia and the younger sister of Julius Amidonia.

Roroa has a keen sense of business and economics causing a rift between her and her militaristic father who ignored the economic development of Amidonia. She agreed with many of the realistic views and ideas of Kazuya Souma.
 
 She is normally very cheerful and tends to speak in merchant slang.

(Source: How a Realist Hero Rebuilt the Kingdom Wiki)

nicknames: Juna Souma, Lady Canaria, Prima Lorelei
about: A blue-haired girl who is called the descendant of Lorelei. 19 years old. She possessed a voice that did not betray her beautiful looks which is how she was introduced to Souma when he held the Talent Recruitment.
voice_actor_name: Ueda, Reina, Garrett, Morgan, Souza, Jacque, Mendoza, Itzel, Schreier, Nadine

name: Elfrieden, Elisha
name_kanji: エリシャ・エルフリーデン
about:
Elisha was the actual successor to the throne of Elfrieden Kingdom, being the last surviving member of the Elfrieden Royal through the Succession Crisis after the death of the 12th King of Elfrieden. She eventually marries "Albert" giving him her family name with it and the role of 13th King of Elfrieden.

In her youth, Elisha was tomboyish for a princess, often taking risks and acting unlike a princess. At the time, she was certain that given her station she was never a actual contender for the throne of Elfrieden. After the first instance of her magic sending memories back to her, she became much more reserved and pragmatic, acting more like a princess despite her desires as she wished to remain alive more. During the events of the succession crisis, she routinely received memories from future-selves and would mentally spiral into a depressive state. It was not until she decided to chose Albert that she began to have hope for the value of her own life again. She was resistant to succeeding the throne, and would force it upon her husband. She remained a devoted supporter through Albert's reign and was a motivating factor behind Kazuya's ascension to the throne. While she is still generally reserved and quiet, she is a doting grandmother to Cian and Kazuha.

(Source: How a Realist Hero Rebuilt the Kingdom Wiki)

name: Mira
about:
Sakimori Kagami is a player of the VRMMORPG Ark Earth Online and is the foremost expert in the area of Summoning Magic. His Character, Dunbalf Ganadore is considered one of the expert class players who stands at the height of magic. After putting a lot of effort into using a cash item called the Vanity Case, he accidentally turned his character into a little girl. This just happened to be when he was brought into the Second World where Ark Earth Online became the reality. Forcing him to profess herself as the disciple of the Wiseman to hide his identity.

(Source: She Professed Herself Pupil of the Wise Man Wiki)

about:

Later, when Elior Forest got attacked by Pandora, Regulus Corneas and the Kurohebi, Arch was ordered to bring Emilia to safety, however the two of them got surrounded by the Kurohebi and so, he sacrificed himself to save Emilia from the Kurohebi.

about:

(Source: Re:Zero Wikia)

name: Beatrice
about: A mysterious mage who was hired by Roswaal to keep his ancient magical tomes safe in his enormous library. She has the ability to warp any room in the mansion to this library whenever she chooses, but can't completely leave the mansion. Despite of her cold behavior and verbal abuses to Subaru, Beatrice can't stand if people are hurt in front of her and becomes one of people that Subaru can trust.

name: Clind
about:
Clind is a house steward serving the Miload Family. Clind is well mannered, highly considerate of others, is extremely skilled as a servant, and tends to add idioms to the end of his sentences. Despite his good traits, he sometimes jokes around a little while behaving in a polite manner, and is also a lolicon. However, he claims that he isn't drawn to them because they're young but rather because they have pure and genuine souls, and people who have such souls are typically young. Because of this, he was able to determine that Emilia was mentally young for her age and that Lewes' soul was much more mature than her appearance suggested. Although he has known Frederica for ten years starting from the time he began working as a manservant, he tends to be prejudiced toward her appearance, resulting in bad relations between the two of them.

about:
Maria Campbell is the first commoner to enroll in magic school in over 100 years and possesses the rarest type of magic: light magic. She is the heroine of the otome game "Fortune Lover," the universe that they are currently in.

Due to differences in class, she is bullied heavily. Originally, she would be saved by the love interests, but Katarina instead takes on the role of protecting and befriending her. She loves to bake and Katarina encourages her to do so.

Birthday: June 24
Position: Eldest daughter of a duke
Personality: Pure and dense
Magic Element: Earth
Specialty: Tree Climbing, Earth Raiser

The only daughter of Duke Claes who regains her memories of her past life when she hits her head on a rock when she was eight. In her past life, she was an otaku and she remembered the night before she died, she was playing an Otome game called "Love Fortune" which is now the world she is in except she isn't the heroine. She is the main rival, and no matter which route she takes, she gets a terrible ending!

Her thoughts are sometimes portrayed by five chibi versions of herself that exist only in her mind. They are Happy Catarina, Studious Catarina, Fearless Catarina, Spineless Catarina, and Chairman Catarina.

about: The youngest sister (of four) and disliked by her sister, Mary is initially a shy girl with a passion for gardening. Her mother is the second wife of her father, after the first wife died. The new wife was not very welcome and passed away when Mary was five years old. Betrothed to Alan Stuart at a young age.

name: Tokisaki, Kurumi
nicknames: Nightmare, Worst Spirit, Spirit of Time
about:
Birthday: June 10
Height: 157 cm (5'2")
Code name: Nightmare
Spirit number: 3
Species: Spirit
Angel: Zafkiel
Weapon: Clock type
Astral Dress: Elohim
Affiliation: Raizen High School (temporary)
Hobbies: Killing people, teasing Shidou
Likes: Weaponry, sweets, kitties
Dislikes: Humans, AST 
Strength: 109
Consistency: 80
Spiritual power: 220
Agility: 103
Intelligence: 201
Rank: S-Class Spirit
Famous quote: "I want his power. I want to make him mine and become one with him."

Kurumi Tokisaki is the main antagonist in the series. She is the third Spirit to be encountered in the series and is the most dangerous and lethal Spirit. She is heavily obsessed with Shidou and has the ability to manipulate time. Her codename is Nightmare. She has a split personality: that of a gentle, mysterious high school girl with a slow talking pattern, and that of a psychopathic killer. Kurumi is very aggressive in her actions which makes it harder for Shidou to capture her. Kurumi can be described a person whose personality is hard to read, possessing a well-polished dislike of humanity that borders on mistrust, something she shared with many Spirits in their debut. She is a skilled actress, capable of putting on the façade of an innocent, curious young girl when she needs to, shown when she registered as a student at the Raizen High School, even speaking in a very polite manner; however, under that mask lies a psychotic woman, prone to fits of insane laughter that possesses no regard for human life, regarding them as a food source to restore her own time, and thus, a disposable commodity. There is a twisted justice behind her methods, however, as the people that she brutally murdered were would-be rapists and animal abusers. In hindsight, Kurumi possesses some degree of innocence that her psychotic behavior have not entirely ruined; she has a soft spot for small animals and other creatures. She once slaughtered four humans not because she needed to replenish her time, but because they were trying to kill a kitten, this is the closest to a humanizing emotion that she has. Mana reported that Kurumi is the most dangerous spirit known, who has personally killed over 10,000 people which does not include the spacequake's victims within that statistics. Kurumi used unstated and unexplained methods to personally transfer into Shidou Itsuka's high school and classroom so she can get closer to him. Her purposes and reasons in this transfer are simple; consume Shidou Itsuka, in doing so gain their memories, goals, fears and obsessions. In some non-canon stories, the clone Shidou seduced shows some "independent" attitude, almost rebellious, and openly acts lovey-dovey with Shidou, which causes troubles to the "main" Kurumi and even leads to confrontation with her.



Kurumi has the ability to manipulate the 4th dimension, mainly time, but her main power is associated with controlling shadows. Shadow is her primary power while Time is her secondary power in terms of usage. Combined with the power of time, she can create a clone with all her experiences, memories, abilities, etc. These clones however are shadows of her past selves who contain feelings the current Kurumi no longer possesses, Kurumi will kill these clones if they are swayed away from her goals. These clones are less powerful than Kurumi herself as she has mentioned in the last chapter of volume 3 and in the epilogue of volume 4. She can form a single clone by shooting herself with Zafkiel or bring out all of her clones at once from a pool of shadows which she also uses to draw them all back in and all the time they've collected. She can also call her clones partially through small fields of shadows, most often to hold someone in place and prevent them from moving. To activate any power she needs, she first needs to call her Angel (regardless of whether or not the Angel has been summoned already or not), and to position both of her guns just like a clock: The musket on 12 and the flintlock points at the number of the bullet. Next she needs to shoot the bullet at the target with the hand gun. In case she needs it for herself, she will be required to shoot it at her head. She also has the ability to call and dismiss spacequakes at will, as shown in the series while she confronts Shidou on the school's rooftop.

(Source: Wikipedia, DAL Wiki)

name: White Queen
about:
Height: 160 cm (5'2")
Age: 17-18 (Physically)
Gender: Female
Occupation: Dominion
Species: Spirit
Angel: Lucifugus (狂々帝, Kyōkyōtei, lit. Lunatic Emperor)
Weapon: Astronomical Clock, Saber, Gun
Astral Dress: Unknown
Hobbies: Ruling her Dominion, waging wars with other Dominions, committing spiritcide, killing and torturing other Kurumi's clones, conquesting other worlds.
Dislikes: Kurumi Tokisaki
Allies: Bishop, Rook and Knight
Enemies: Kurumi Tokisaki
Rank: SS-Class threat
Famous quote: "You think you can kill me? That’s utterly amusing."
List of the bullets:

Aries Bullet [Taleh]: Effects Unknown.

Taurus Bullet [Shor]: Effects Unknown.

Gemini Bullet [Teomim]: Effects Unknown.

Cancer Bullet [Sartan]: Warps spacetime in order to protect the user or assault the enemy.

Leo Bullet [Arie]: 'Eats' space, consuming in the same way [Yud Aleph] eats time.

Virgo Bullet [Betulah]: Create a crack in space and allow a person to travel between places.

Libra Bullet [Moznaim]: Rules over space and can reverse cause and effect within that space.

Scorpio Bullet [Akrab]: Puts the user's symbol on the target and turn the target into a rook under their control.

Sagittarius Bullet [Kashat]: Effects Unknown

Capricorn Bullet [G'di]: Effects Unknown

Aquarius Bullet [D'li]: Heals the target completely.

Pisces Bullet [Dagim]: Effects Unknown

White Queen wears a white military dress decorated with epaulettes, and a white admiral's cap with an emblem similar to that of a rising sun on the front of it. In the middle of the emblem is a clock face. She also wears white gloves and white, heeled boots. She has long white hair usually tied in symmetrical twin tails. Her right eye is red-tinted while her left eye appears as a blue clock face. She is stated to look identical to Kurumi, aside from the obvious colour scheme differences.

Rather than a battle maniac, the White Queen is a strategist. She performed infiltration, acts of terrorism, and experiments to change Empty into monsters to strengthen her army. She also captured and tortured Cistus to study and exploit Zaphkiel's power. The White Queen is also callous, aggressive and intelligent. These traits combined together make for a formidable opponent, and this was acknowledged by the other Dominions. She has immense power, and all the tools at her disposal to back it up. She is considered and careful when planning attacks and engaging in battle, and will sacrifice her own soldiers when needed to ensure a victory. She also has the capacity to forward plan, and is uninhibited by taboos in the Neighboring World, one of these including encroaching on other Regions. The White Queen is goal-oriented and believes that her goal is far more important than the lives of her enemies and allies, as shown by how readily she sacrifices her own troops.



(Source: DAL Wik, Villains Wiki, Amino)

name: Ferdinand
about:
Ferdinand is the head priest in the temple of Ehrenfest, as well as the patron and educator of Myne in the temple. Ferdinand teaches and guides her to be a 'proper' shrine maiden and noble lady.

Ferdinand is a serious, disciplined and pragmatic person. He has a bit of a fussy personality, leading him to take on all sorts of responsibilities, including Myne's education. Ferdinand is meritocratic in spite of his social status, despising incompetence and laziness the most, and earning him the reputation of a harsh disciplinarian who would cut off anyone who couldn't meet his standard. The same trait leads him to favor Myne ever since their first interaction, calling her worthwhile to educate.

(Source: Ascendance of a Bookworm Wiki)

name: Myne
about:
Former name (before reincarnation): Motosu Urano (本須 麗乃)

Originally a young woman from our world who just finished her studies to become a librarian and died buried in her own books after an earthquake caused her bookshelves to fall on her, she found herself reincarnated in a very frail body of a 5-year-old young girl called Myne in a fantasy world.

She loves books above everything else and living a quiet life surrounded by books is her long life goal.

She has read a massive amount of books in her former life and has a good memory of the content that especially interested her.

While originally her motivation was only books and she didn't care about anything else, she becomes more and more involved in many other things, as she start to care and love more and more her new family and many other peoples she encounters.

Her body is so frail that she easily get tired after walking for a bit, and whenever she forces herself too much she gets strong fevers that can last for days.

She has a strong talent to teach others and motivate them in their studies.

She is usually very level headed but will go berserk whenever books get involved. The peoples around her know that tendency and will try to reason her whenever she becomes too reckless. As time passes, she became more receptive to those words, especially when they come from Ferdinand and Lutz.

name: Takanashi, Sei
about:
Sei is a Japanese office lady in her twenties who was summoned to Salutania by the Saint Summoning Ritual together with Aira Misono. Her saintly powers include a fifty percent boost in the efficacy of anything she makes using her power. Sei was not immediately recognized as the Saint at the conclusion of the summoning ritual due to her appearance. Offended by the affront, Sei does not reveal that she is actually the Saint (she confirms this in the LN when reading her own status board). During her early months working at the Medicinal Flora Research Institute, her sainthood is nearly found out multiple times due to some accidental scenes with her research. Sei is only publicly acknowledged as the Saint after many people have seen and attested to her abilities. She likes to cook and make cosmetics in her spare time. She owns a cosmetic business in the capital.

(Source: The Saint's Magic Power Is Omnipotent Wiki)

Fina is a kind, honest, and hardworking girl. Having been forced to care for her family at a very young age, she is very responsible and mature. 

She has greenish-brown hair, half of which is usually tied at the back with a large pink ribbon. She has kind lime-green eyes and is usually seen smiling.

Fina wears an ankle length tea-green dress with a light brown vest worn over it. Occasionally she also wears a shoulder bag that contains most of her necessary belongings such as daggers and knives for skinning and money.

about:
Makoto Misumi is one of the three World Travelers who got sent to the Goddess's World.

Originally meant to be the only person to be sent to the other world as per the contract between his parents and the Goddess, but because of her own preferences in beauty standards, she abandons and throws Makoto to the edge of her world into the Wasteland, while secretly kidnapping two other people from Earth and sending them to her world as Heroes. Tsukuyomi, the Moon God of Earth who worked as the middleman for the completion of the contract, helped Makoto and provided him with his blessing and told him to be free and live as he wishes to.

name: Kaga, Michio
about: Michio is a Japanese high school student who was transported to another world. A rather reasonable and calm young man who decided to realize his dream of a quiet, comfortable life and a harem of several slaves in the new world. Despite the fact that he was often bullied in the old world, he did not get angry, but this causes him to sometimes manifest difficulties in communication and emotional tightness, as well as a thirst for human intimacy, love and friendship. Treats his slaves as family members, or rather wives, and expects the same attitude and trust in return. He takes care of his harem, does not force them to do anything and, on the contrary, provides them with everything they need and beyond: from food and clothing to weapons and education, helps them to level up and improves living conditions.

name: Roxanne
about:
Age: 16
Race: Wolfkin

Roxanne is described as stunningly beautiful with enchanting reddish brown eyes, magnificent lips, thick chestnut brown hair, and big breasts. Her height is similar to Michio's, a little over 160 cm. She has soft floppy dog ears on her head.

Roxanne was introduced during Michio's first visit to Vale by Alan the slave merchant. Alan had offered her to Michio, but seeing that Michio couldn't afford her at the time, Alan offered to hold her for 10 days while Michio gathered money. On the 10th day after Alan's offer, Michio returned and purchased Roxanne. Together, they left and headed for the Pavilion Inn. After a minor misunderstanding, Michio told Roxanne that he came form a distant land and admitted that he lacked common sense of the area. He requested that she assist in teaching him common sense as well as how to read and write in the Brahim language to which she hesitantly agreed.

In combat, she carefully watches the enemy so she that she can understand how it's going to move, so that she would only need to move her body a little. The secret of Roxanne's insane ability came from playing with monsters ever since she was a kid, however, she could play like that only because she could dodge.

(Source: Slave Harem Wikia)

name: Fina
about:
Fina is a kind, honest, and hardworking girl. Having been forced to care for her family at a very young age, she is very responsible and mature. 

She has greenish-brown hair, half of which is usually tied at the back with a large pink ribbon. She has kind lime-green eyes and is usually seen smiling.

Fina wears an ankle length tea-green dress with a light brown vest worn over it. Occasionally she also wears a shoulder bag that contains most of her necessary belongings such as daggers and knives for skinning and money.



(Source: Kuma Kuma Kuma Bear Wiki)

name: Tempest, Rimuru
about:
Race: Human (past life) → Slime → Demon Slime 
Age: 37 (past life) → 2 (anime/manga), 3 (light novel)
Sex: male (past life) → Sexless
Title: Ruler of Monsters, Jura-Tempest Federation Chancellor, 
Divine protection: Storm Crest
Magic: Element Magic archive, Spirit Magic archive, Greater Spirit summoning, Greater Demon summoning, 
Ability:
Species Skill - Universal Sense, Universal Thread, Universal Shapeshift, Infinite Regeneration, Demon Lord Haki, Enhanced Replication
Ultimate Skill - Wisdom King Raphael, King of Gluttony Beelzebuth, Covenant King Uriel, Storm King Veldora, 
Resistance: Physical Attack Nullification, Natural Effects Nullification, Abnormal Condition Nullification, Spiritual/Mental Attack Resistance, Holy-Demonic Attack Resistance

The main protagonist of the series and Founder as well as Chancellor and King of the monster nation known as the Jura-Tempest Federation. Originally Mikami Satoru, a 37-year-old general contractor, he was stabbed by a passing robber while protecting one of his co-workers and reincarnated in a new world as a slime, one of the lowest monsters on the food chain.

In spite of the situations he finds himself in, he often tends to be very easygoing, yet calculating and cautious. A pacifist at heart, he tries to avoid casualties and save people if possible and wishes to maintain good relations with humans.


(Source: Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken Wiki, edited)
voice_actor_name: Okasaki, Miho, Seyad, Shérine, Karbowski, Brittney, Giorgio, Elisa

name: Nagumo, Hajime
about:
Hajime was a complete otaku and always came to class with a sleepy expression. He was always bullied and was disliked by both of his male and female classmates for being close to their idol-like classmate Kaori. After wishing for his annoying classmates to be summoned to another world, the next thing he saw was they were on top of a pillar like structure in another world to become heroes.

He obtained the job of "Synergist" and continued to be bullied due to also being weak in this new world. He eventually fell into an abyss due to being hit by a classmate's fireball where he survived though a hell-like environment to become the powerful man he is today.

Hajime at the beginning of the story is said to have black hair and also has a slim body. He also had a kind face and attitude. But after falling in the abyss and eating a wolf-like monster, his body began to violently degenerate. When he drunk the sacred water, it made his body heal by destroying his bones and muscles then healing over and over again until he got a very muscular body due to overcompensation.

Due to the stress of breaking and healing, his hair turned white, a victim of the Marie Antoinette syndrome. His eyes also turned red and his body gained tattoo-like red lines which is the sign of him becoming a demonic monster similar to the monsters he ate that also possessed red lines along their bodies.

His personality was at first kind though he was considered incompetent. But after falling in the abyss, he became cruel and would kill any person who wants to cause him misfortune. He would also smile in front of danger which made Shia call him a new species of monster called "Predator." He may be cruel but he cares for his comrades.

(Source: Arifureta Wiki)

name: Hiyama, Daisuke
about: One of Hajime's classmates. He's the leader of those that harass Hajime.

name: Loggins, Meld
about: He is the Knight Commander of the Heiligh Kingdom. He was responsible for overseeing the training of the summoned heroes from the other world.

name: Shirasaki, Kaori
about:
Kaori is one the most caring personalities in the series. She is a classmate of Hajime's back in their original world. She admires Hajime for his "strong" personalty and is the only classmate who pays attention to Hajime's existence in class even if she is popular in their school.

When summoned to another world, she receives the "Healer" job.

name: Yaegashi, Shizuku
about: Kaori's best friend. She's the childhood friend of Kouki and her family runs a dojo.

name: Menou
about:
A priestess who specializes in hunting down the Lost Ones before they can become a threat. She is well aware that most of the Lost Ones she kills are innocents who have done nothing wrong, but her training dictates that they cannot be allowed to live as their Pure Concept will inevitably corrupt them. Her village was once destroyed by one of the lost ones, leaving her the only survivor.

(Source: Wikipedia)
voice_actor_name: Saeki, Iori, Karbowski, Brittney, Wild, Annie

name: Tokitou, Akari
about:
Akari Tokitou is a naïve, carefree, happy-go-lucky girl. She cares strongly for , and demonstrates this by constantly trying to protect her. During the process of being summoned into Menou's world, Akari is assigned the Pure Concept of Time (which is initially improperly attached to her soul). 

Although usually unaware of it, she is virtually unkillable due to her ability. Akari has strongly hinted that prior to being summoned, she has had a rather lonely life in Japan which has caused her to embrace being in Menou's world.

When Akari has her memories of past regressions, she is a very capable user of her Pure Concept. She is not well trained as a fighter though, and in combat is forced to rely on her power completely.

She decides to go on a journey with Menou because she believes meeting her was fate. However, Menou is trying to find a way to kill her. Usually Akari is unaware of this, but in emergencies she gains back her memories from previous regressions. Her goal is to be killed by Menou while keeping her alive. After the emergency has been resolved, Akari uses Regression: Memories, Soul and Spirit on herself to erase her knowledge of the past time loops.

(Source: The Executioner and Her Way of Life Wiki)

name: Ashuna
name_kanji: アーシュナ・グリザリカ
about:
Ashuna is the Princess of the Kingdom of Grisarika. A real against-the-flow, do-it-my-way princess. Ever in search of an exciting battle, she rebels against regal dress and cuts down enemies with a royal sword emblazoned with Sigils. Because of her absolute confidence in her body, she eschews armor and stifling clothes.

She loves strong and beautiful things, and has a warlike personality with absolute confidence in her body and strength that she has trained herself.

(Source: The Executioner and Her Way of Life Wiki)

name: Mitsuki
about: A boy suddenly summoned from Japan to another world who has a destructive ability.

He is strong, cool, and has a lot of slimes. He appears to be an "ordinary tamer" at first.

(Source: Tensei Kenja Wiki, edited)

name: Maha
about:
Maha was born the solo heiress of a famous trading company who was betrayed by her parents right-hand man so he could usurp the company out from under both her and her parents. Her parents were murdered and sensing her life was in danger she fled to Milteu were she gets together a small group of abandoned orphans together and starts to give tours to people so that her and her friends can get by earnestly. Which works until a local noble places a bounty on their heads to be then sold into slavery and prostitution. She and her friends are saved by Lugh when he is sent to Milteu for undercover work to train as a merchant under an alias his father had created for him Illig Balor. Illig Balor bought her out of slavery and had her adopted by his merchant family the Balor's to seaver as his right-hand man and run both his cosmetic empire and his information network. 

She spends a couple of years being trained as one of Lugh's assassin assistants and is extremely important to Lugh. Overtime she falls in love with Lugh saying "At first we admired you as our great older brother. But as we got older how could we not fall in love with the best guy around." Lugh not wanting to take advantage of her at first turns her down. 
Maha is smart and clever but with Lugh's assassin training she becomes strong and agile as well as an excellent acting director of Lugh's growing cosmetics and chocolate empire. She exposes this rule Lugh quietly set for himself about not taking advantage of her and Tarte and remind him that it is encouraged and normal that nobles take on a couple mistresses.

(Source: Girlsdeadmonster)
voice_actor_name: Shimoji, Shino, Torrens, Célia, Bishop, Hayden, Souza, Valentina, Schmidt, Josephine, Salman, Gabriela
voice_actor_lang: Japanese, French, English, Spanish, German, Portuguese (BR)

name: Tarte
about:
Lugh's personal servant and one of his assassination assistants. She cares deeply for Lugh because he saved her life. Tarte's family often call Tarte useless and worthless giving her a complex about this labeling, when things got tough her family abandoned her because they could not feed everyone in the family. 
Nearly starved to death and alone she wonders into the forest where she has a dream in which God tells her to travel to Tuatha Dé territory were she will have a fateful encounter. Lugh then saved her from being eaten by a pack of wolves moments before they got to her.
After saving her life and Lugh telling her he needs her, she spends the next two years training her to be an assassin worthy of Lugh. 

After saving her life Tarte slowly starts to fall in love with Lugh and with Dia and Lugh's mothers encouragement becomes one of his mistresses. Which at first Lugh was not on board with the idea because he felt like he was taking advantage of her.

She has an aptitude with spears. When Lugh sends her into battle to get real combat experience her proficiency with spears and magic quickly earn her the title The Lightning Quick Battle Maiden. Something that embarrasses her when Lugh teases her about it.

(Source: Girlsdeadmonster)

name: Lloyd

voice_actor_name: Simon, Jonathan, Matsukawa, Hiroki, Franco, Hércules

name: Evelogia
about:
Evelogia is a young man and also the Demon King in the world he resides in.
As a baby, his parents found him and raised him to later regret their decision due to his destructive powers scaring them and all the other villagers.

He finds it difficult to restrain his power due to it being emitted when he is under emotional distress. This causes him to apologize to his lover Gozu constantly even over minute issues to the point Gozu has to yell at him to stop apologizing. 

He is unmoved by what others say about him, yet he is quite sensitive to comments made by specific people or if they're ill-natured towards Gozu. He is a Rational thinker though, of which always puts his beliefs and morals ahead of his own gain. Rather than being a destructive demon king, he acts consciously to help others in need.

He has short cream coloured hair with striking red eyes. He is short in stature and very slim which gets him mistaken as a woman by Mackiddie. He wears a red black and cream Robe alongside a frilly white undershirt, grey shorts and black boots.

(Source: Maou Evelogia ni Mi wo Sasage yo Wiki)

name: Gozu, Toshiaki
about: A regular man from his own world is teleported into the game world that is real. After dying from a gunshot he found himself as a mob assassin hired to kill the demon king Evelogia. Recognizing the world as one in a game he played as a child Gozu is thrilled to identify the demon king particularly since he was the only one who ever inspired him. Loving Eve dearly Gozu also uses what he knows of the game story events to avert them and prevent Eve from being killed by the hero.

name: Cayna
about:
Real name: Keina Kagami (各務 桂菜)

When she was playing the VRMMORP "Leadale," she was known as the "Silver Rings Witch" and was one of the top players. When she transfers to that world 200 years later, she becomes an adventurer, but level is way too high, so she can't be too careless.

(Source: Official Site)

name: Caerick
about:
Caerick is Mai-Mai's son, younger twin brother of Caerina and Cayna's grandson.

Caerick is a young elf and the younger twin brother of Caerina, he is the father of Idzik, Caerick is a skilled merchant who runs Sakaiya, a large company that does business across the continent. He spent about fifty years establishing the commerce network that fell to pieces after the seven nations became three. Caerick is considered the founding father of the Merchants Guild. He enjoys a little trickery and intrigue in business, but it's not a corrupt merchant. Although he initially upset his grandmother Cayna, once they made up, he enjoyed helping her in all sorts of ways. His greatest concern right now is finding someone to take his twin sister's hand in marriage.

(Source: In the Land of Leadale Wiki)

She is strict, but attentive to the feelings of subordinates. Alpha found and recruited six core members of the organization in an effort to destroy the cult of the demon Diablos.
